greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: First solution mod p of x^4 = 2 for primes p such that only two solutions exist.
comment: Conjecture: no integer occurs more than three times in this sequence. Confirmed for the first 2399 terms of A007522 (primes < 100000). There are integers which do occur thrice, e.g. 221, 1159.
formula: a(n) = first (least) solution mod p of x^4 = 2, where p is the n-th prime such that x^4 = 2 has only two solutions mod p, i.e. p is the n-th term of A007522.
example: a(8) = 4, since 127 is the eighth term of A007522 and 4 is the first solution mod 127 of x^4 = 2.
program: (PARI): a065907(m) = local(s); forprime(p = 2,m,s = []; for(x = 0,p-1, if(x^4%p == 2%p,s = concat(s,[x]))); if(matsize(s)[2] == 2,print1(s[1],","))) a065907(1600)
results.author: _Klaus Brockhaus_, Nov 29 2001
